page.title: 10CANAL/IRWELL IN RADCLIFFE
page.content: CONSTRUCTED BETWEEN 1791 AND 1796 TO LINK BOLTON AND BURY WITH MANCHESTER - FOR MUCH OF ITS ROUTE IT CLOSELY FOLLOWS THE RIVERS{CROAL}AND{IRWELL}. CANAL TRAFFIC DECLINED FROM THE LATE 1800'S AND NAVIGATION CEASED IN 1960. SOME SECTIONS HAVE BEEN INFILLED BUT OTHERS HAVE BEEN MADE INTO ATTRACTIVE WALKS AND WILDLIFE HABITATS. MUCH OF THE LANDSCAPE, SCARRED BY INDUSTRIAL ABUSE (PAPER MILLS,COAL MINES,CHEMICAL WORKS) HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY RECLAIMED RECENTLY. ONLY A FEW PAPER MILLS NOW REMAIN. TODAY THE RECLAIMED AREAS HAVE HAD MANY FOOTPATHS MADE. THE CROAL/IRWELL VALLEY WARDEN SERVICE ISSUE INFORMATION LEAFLETS OF SUGGESTED WALKS AND THINGS TO SEE.
